The event started promptly at 10am and went on as late as 7:30pm at night. The event was broadcast using ustream and watchers commented that both the video and audio was very good. The event was a combination of bug solving as well as discuss/debate FOSS, Pool, and enjoying face to face interaction with other ubuntu members.

=== Topic ===
'''Ubuntu Global Jam'''<<BR>>
The New York State Ubuntu !LoCo is proud to announce that it will be holding a live event coinciding the the <nowiki>[[UbuntuGlobalJam|Ubuntu Global Jam]]</nowiki> around the weekend of '''26th - 28th March 2010'''.<<BR>>

The Global Jam incorporates many different 'Themes' all of which will be celebrated the Saturday of the 27th in Syracuse NY.

* '''<nowiki>[[Jams-Bugs|Bugs]]</nowiki>''' - finding, triaging and fixing bugs.
* '''<nowiki>[[Jams-Testing|Testing]]</nowiki>''' - testing the new release and reporting your feedback.
* '''<nowiki>[[Jams-Upgrade|Upgrade]]</nowiki>''' - upgrading to Lucid from Hardy or Karmic and reporting your upgrade experience.
* '''<nowiki>[[Jams-Docs|Documentation]]</nowiki>''' - writing documentation about how to use Ubuntu and how to join the community.
* '''<nowiki>[[Jams-Translations|Translations]]</nowiki>''' - translating Ubuntu and helping to make it available in everyone's local language.
* '''<nowiki>[[Jams-Packaging|Packaging]]</nowiki>''' - work on Ubuntu packages and improve them.
* '''Other''' - other types of contribution such as marketing, packaging, advocacy etc.

=== Video ===
The event in Syracuse will be broadcast over the internet and can be found on the link below

 http://www.ustream.tv/channel/ubuntu-global-jam
